snippet: The United States hopes the dialogue can help set norms and end what it says is a daily barrage of computer break-ins and theft of corporate and government secrets by Chinese hackers.
abstract: United States and China agree to hold regular, high-level talks on how to set standards of behavior for cybersecurity and commercial espionage; it is first diplomatic effort to defuse tensions over what US says is daily barrage of computer break-ins and theft of corporate and government secrets.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: The United States hopes the dialogue can help set norms and end what it says is a daily barrage of computer break-ins and theft of corporate and government secrets by Chinese hackers.

headline.seo: U.S. and China to Hold Talks on Hacking
headline.main: U.S. and China Agree to Hold Regular Talks on Hacking
headline.print_headline: U.S. and China Will Hold Talks About Hacking
